com.canoo.dolphin.client

Interface ControllerProxy<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ControllerProxyImpl

    public interface ControllerProxy<T>
    A proxy that can be used to interact with the server side controller. Whenever a ControllerProxy is created in the client a matching controller instance is created on the server side. The proxy can be used to interact with the controller instance on the server side and to work with the model of the MVC group.
    It's important that a controller proxy will be destroyed when the view isn't needed anymore. When calling the destroy() method on teh client the server side controller will be destroyed, too. Otherwiese the controller on the server will automatically be destroyed when the client will be exited or the ClientContext will be disconnected (see ClientContext.disconnect()).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <T> CompletableFuture<ControllerProxy<T>> createController(String name)
      Creates a ControllerProxy instance for the controller with the given name.
      CompletableFuture<Void> destroy()
      Destroys this proxy and the controller on the server side.
      String getId()
      Returns the unique ID for the controller.
      T getModel()
      Returns the model aof the defined MVC group.
      CompletableFuture<Void> invoke(String actionName, Param... params)
      By calling this method an action will be called on the server side controller (see @DolphinAction annotation for more details).

    • Method Detail

      • getModel

        T getModel()
        Returns the model aof the defined MVC group. This model will automatically be synchronized with the server. If no model is specified in the server controller (see @DolphinModel annotation for more details) this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the model or null

      • invoke

        CompletableFuture<Void> invoke(String actionName,
                               Param... params)
        By calling this method an action will be called on the server side controller (see @DolphinAction annotation for more details). The method won't block until the action was handled on the server. If you need this information the method returns a CompletableFuture that is completed when the action was on the server.
        Parameters:
        actionName - unique name of the action (defined by method name or @DolphinAction annotation in the server controller.
        params - params that can be used for the action call. The server action must define the sama param count with matching names.
        Returns:
        A future that is completed when the action was handled on the server. If an exception was thrown on the server side action the CompletableFuture.get() call will throw an exception.

      • destroy

        CompletableFuture<Void> destroy()
        Destroys this proxy and the controller on the server side.
        Returns:
        A future that is completed when the destruction was handled on the server. If an exception was thrown on the server side the CompletableFuture.get() call will throw an exception.

      • getId

        String getId()
        Returns the unique ID for the controller.
        Returns:
        the unique ID for the controller

      • createController

        <T> CompletableFuture<ControllerProxy<T>> createController(String name)
        Creates a ControllerProxy instance for the controller with the given name. Currently this methods does exactly the same as ClientContext.createController(String) but in a future release controller hierarchies will be supported by this method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the model that is bound to the controller and view
        Parameters:
        name - the unique name of the controller type
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture that defines the creation of the controller.
